page.title: 18DIALECT FOREST OF DEAN
page.content: (continued) An'now we du zee the children of theze present day, Most of um well ved,-content, in nearly every way. Thair'ave bin zum chonges zince eighteen eighty-dree when theze school wuz started fer the likes of thee and me. Theze walls 'ave encompassed unknown hopes,ambitions-fears. Many young lives moulded in them passin' years. At theze Centenary,-when we be countin'up our joys, Think of undeds an'undeds of little girls and boys. An' spare a thought,as well we should, an'zoy a little prayer, Fer all the dedicated teachers az 'ave given love and care.
